trial_identification.studytitle: Can Chiropractic care improve reading ability in children with learning delay?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Can Chiropractic care improve reading ability in children with learning delay?

interventions.interventions: Specific low force chiropractic adjustments to reduce dural tension. 1. The duration of each adjustment will be ten minutes. 2. The part of the body where the adjustment will be made is determined on each visit by a neurological protocol. Sacral, upper cervical or cranial adjustments are the most common type needed by children however occasionally the primary problem may be in an extremity. 3. The duration of the overall intervention is 16 weeks. 4. The frequency of the adjustments is once a week for 8 weeks followed by once a fornight for 8 weeks.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Reading ability as determined by the Neale Analysis of Reading Ability.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 16 weeks which is the end of the intervention period.

secondaryOutcome.outcome:
Neurodevelopmental level achieved. NEUROMATURATIONAL DELAY EXAMINATION
1.Anthropometry 2. Adrenal Function via blood pressure, pupil dilation and kidney punch test. 3. Hearing 4. Vision Snellen eye chart 5. Synkinesis 6. Dysdiadochokinesis 7. Stimulus extinction 8. Finger agnosia 9. Choreiform movements 10. Left-right discrimination (laterality) 11. Gross motor 12. Fine motor 13. Visual-perceptual-motor 14. Sequencing- Auditory and Visual 15. Goodenough Draw-A-Man
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 16 weeks which is the end of the intervention period.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Child must be unable to read at expected level for his/her age and level of education.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: The child is receiving any other remedial treatment (independent of their school)related to reading at the same time.

trial_design.concealment: When the person (in this case school teacher identifies a student as reading below expected level) s/he will be unaware whether or not the student will be included in the trial. Sealed opaque envelopes will be used.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomisation table from a statistic book will be used to randomly allocate students to the treatment group.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study is being undertaken as a masters degree thesis. There is alot of anecdotal evidence of chiropractic care helping children with learning disabilities. The purpose of this research is to use a scientific method to measure if children having difficulty reading can benefit from chiropactic care.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: McTimoney College of Chiropractic Ethics Committee
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Kimber House 1 Kimber Road Abingdon Oxon OX141BZ
